intro: Tricalysia lasiodelphys, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elliptical leaflets and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is adapted to well-drained soils. Tricalysia lasiodelphys is also valued for its ability to provide shade and support local wildlife.
